Description: Marl pottery jar with a small flat base, convex sides, a slightly inset low neck and roll-over rim; decorated in loosely applied red paint with a series of five tree-like motifs with branches overlapping at the shoulder, the trunk running vertical down the length of the jar. Between one set of trees is a ‘sun-burst’ design: a rough circle with short strokes all round, a dot in the centre; between another set is are two diagonal lines with short strokes coming down along the length of each one, and in a third space a single line of the same type carelessly painted.
Curator's comments: Similar to Decorated ware D24B in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric pottery (1921)
Bibliographic references: Brunton 1937 / Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture (pl. xliv.5)
